item.title: Quick Read: Blockchain's Future after Bitcoin
item.description:
Quick Read: Blockchain's Future after Bitcoin

In January 2016, fellow Bitcoin developer, Mike Hearn, dropped the bomb - Bitcoin has failed. While "failing" might be a bit overdramatic, his reasoning is far from an overstatement.

item.title: Bitcoin is a better bet than pound, euro post-Brexit: Blockchain CEO
item.description:
Bitcoin is a better bet than pound, euro post-Brexit: Blockchain CEO

With the Brexit hammering global equities and currencies, bitcoin has bucked the trend, jumping almost 10 percent immediately post-Brexit, lending some legitimacy to the cryptocurrency. Although the unregulated alternative to cash money is considered high risk, in part due to its volatility, Peter Smith, chief executive of Blockchain, a bitcoin wallet, said the cryptocurrency was a better bet than regular currencies.

item.title: Payment Service Provider Worldcore Accepts Bitcoin
item.description:
Payment Service Provider Worldcore Accepts Bitcoin

Worldcore, a payment service provider that allows access to international banking and global transfers regardless of origin, has partnered with BitPay to accept bitcoin payments. Worldcore users can now withdraw funds to bank accounts or prepaid debit cards with minimal fees.

item.title: Engine for Blockchain: Toyota Financial Services joins R3
item.description:
Engine for Blockchain: Toyota Financial Services joins R3

Toyota Financial Services and R3 Consortium have announced the start of their collaboration on research and development of Blockchain applications. Uniting over fifty of the biggest banks and corporations in the world the R3 Consortium seeks how to incorporate Blockchain solutions in the financial and nonfinancial sectors.

item.title: Investors see bitcoin as safe haven - Business News | The Star Online
item.description:
Investors see bitcoin as safe haven - Business News | The Star Online

Demand is up following drop in pound as a result of Brexit PORTLAND: Demand surged for bitcoin as a safe haven from the British pound, which plummeted after the UK voted to leave the European Union (EU). The pound fell to its lowest in more than 30 years, driving demand for assets such as US Treasuries and gold.

item.title: Ethereum Price Technical Analysis - ETH About To Break Higher? - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Ethereum Price Technical Analysis - ETH About To Break Higher? - NEWSBTC

Ethereum price after finding buyers below $14.00 started to move higher, and currently looks set to break a major resistance. Ethereum price after finding buyers below $14.00 started to move higher, and currently looks set to break a major resistance. Ethereum price slowly and steadily moving higher against the US dollar, and looks set for more upsides.

item.title: What is Ethereum?
item.description:
What is Ethereum?

Sanders definitely has a chance. It's entirely possible that Clinton could drop out of the race for some reason. A health issue, a scandal, a major gaffe, a press revelation could all take their toll and she could be forced to pull out. And then Sanders is pretty much the man.

item.title: The Crypto Show: Brexit & The DAO with Jeff Berwick, Daniel Krawiz, Brian Deery and Christopher David.
item.description:
The Crypto Show: Brexit & The DAO with Jeff Berwick, Daniel Krawiz, Brian Deery and Christopher David.

The first hour we talk with Jeff Berwick about Brexit, Bitcoin, Bilderberg and his plans for Anarchapulco 2017. Then talk with Chris David about the kick off Arcade City drivers implementing Unsung.org . It was a huge success. Then we talk with Daniel Krawiz and Brian Deery about the failure of the DAO and the pitfalls of Ethereum.

item.title: Three Hacked Hospital Databases Up For Sale On Deep Web
item.description:
Three Hacked Hospital Databases Up For Sale On Deep Web

A new week has started, which also means there is a brand new data breach to discuss. One hacker managed to obtain over 650,000 healthcare records using an exploit in the Remote Desktop Protocol used by an institution. Although it remains unclear as to which hospital was attacked, this story goes to show how lackluster IT security keeps plaguing the healthcare industry.

item.title: The 1% don't use Bitcoin Exchanges
item.description:
The 1% don't use Bitcoin Exchanges

Given that the Brexit is still fresh in our minds - the big question of "how will the global financial elite diversify their assets" is one that every money manager and their clients are discussing this weekend. Great timing for a Bitcoin post! I sent a tweet out earlier this morning (followed by a tweet storm!)
